thread.title: Intra-governmental committee to deal with Pune garbage issue
thread.title_full: Intra-governmental committee to deal with Pune garbage issue - The Times of India

author: Prasad Kulkarni
title: Intra-governmental committee to deal with Pune garbage issue
text:
PUNE: A special 'intra-governmental technical and expert committee' will help in solving the garbage problems of city in the days to come. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will join hands with other government agencies for a permanent solution to the issue.
"The research and development (R&D) works will be carried out as the key mandate of the committee. Committee will have scientists, retried senior government officials and PMC officials. The committee will give long term plan and new solutions to improve garbage processing. Most of these people will part and parcel of the government organisations by some or the other way," said a senior official of PMC, while speaking to reporters.
The official added that the decision to form the committee has been taken after repeated agitation of the villagers of Uruli Phursungi, where the PMC sends the city's garbage.
In January, the villagers had stopped garbage trucks and had protested against improper garbage management. The state government had asked the PMC to stop garbage dumping by September. The civic administration had given a 'special action plan to mitigate the garbage problem' in the meetings held in January. The solid waste management department of the PMC will submit a review report on the in the days to come.
Pune generates nearly 1,600 metric tonne garbage every day. Out of that nearly 250 tonne is wet garbage and 850 tonnes is dry, while 500 tonnes is mixed garbage. Civic officials say that of the total garbage generated in the city every day, around 15% is plastic. The quantity is growing day by day as the population is increasing. Processing all this garbage is big issue due to non-availability of sites in the city.
